normal_day: ^Good morning, commander. Ava here, to give you your first refresher course.

first_things: ^First things first. Our communication system is quite simple. Say the name of the person you mean to address and the system will make sure your transmission goes their way. So in this case, if you wish to reply to me, first say Ava and then the message you want to send me. Do you understand?
^[Yes, affirmative, of course, no problem, sure, yay, alright, understood, understand, ok, correct, go on, continue, yeah, got it, get it]
^[No, not, what, negative, nay, not understand, not understood, not ok, not correct, don't, wait, nah]

g-0: ^You are in orbit over the moon, with two researchers down on the surface. It is your job to make sure they get the information and orders they need. You are in command. I will also occasionally be providing you with information. Still with me so far?
^[Yes, affirmative, of course,no problem, sure, yay, alright, understood, understand, ok, correct, continue, go on, yeah, got it, get it, still, with you]

c: ^Good! Your team on the ground consists of Alexa and Christina. Both are researchers. They are about to head out on their usual morning research run.

g-0: ^[No, not, what, negative, nay, not understood, not understand, not ok, don't, wait, nah]

c: ^Well, you are the leader of a small research expedition to our moon, which is dangerous and unexplored. You have two researchers on the surface. Alexa and Christina. Your job is keeping them safe and to relay information between them and me. I am back on the planet surface, functioning as ground control.

g-1: ^Your job today is the same as most days. Relaying interesting information to me and guiding the mission below. I've got most sensors on this side and I might be able to provide you with important information. Like right now, I see your team is waiting by the airlock, ready to go. You should tell Alexa to get going.
^[going, go, leave, move, get, advance, depart, moving, to work, head out]
g-2: ^Good morning to you too, boss, I will head out then. The skyline looks a little more loaded than usual, but it should not be any trouble.
^Hey commander. I'll get going too. I Will let you know if there's anything new worth mentioning.
^Ah, very good. I see both of them have moved out of the base and are heading south in their buggies. Good work, commander.
^Hey boss, could you tell Ava there are some new green crystals down here?
g-3: ^Crystals? Tell them to be careful, those could  explode.
^[careful, caution, cautious, alert, attentive, deliberation, explode, explosive, avoid, don't touch]

c: ^Got it, boss. I'll steer clear of them for now.

buggy_breaks: ^Commander, my buggy just broke down, do you want me to try to fix it or go on on foot?
^[Walk, leave, go, on foot, don't fix, don't repair, do not fix, don't mend, do not mend]
^[don't walk, do not walk, do not leave, don't leave, Repair, fix, mend, restore, stay]
walk_on: ^Okay, commander. I'll move on on foot.
fix_it: ^Driveshaft seems to be disconnected. How do I repair this, can you ask Ava?

^[Can't fix, can't repair,can't mend, can not mend, can not repair, can not fix, walk, don't]

storm_hits: ^We are getting rough weather here, sand everywhere. We should head back. What do you want us to do, boss?
^Wait, she needs to come pick me up in the buggy, it's a long walk still.
^Can I go pick her up, boss?
^[Yes, pick, go ahead, go, alright, sure, affirmative, yay, ok, moving, going, yeah]
^[No, can't, keep going, keep moving, shouldn't, not, negative, nay, don't, nah]

c: ^No, sorry boss, I will not leave Christina behind. I am going to get her.

storm_worsens: ^It's getting worse down here There's sand everywhere and heavy gales!
^I'm seeing a large sandstorm approaching our girls on the ground. Get them to safety.
^Where should we go, to homebase or the shuttle? Base is closer, but we might get stranded there if the storm gets worse.

mission_review: ^Right commander, there is not much more we can do, so let's get your performance review out of the way. I have listened to the recordings of today and found that you

b: ^decided to send them the long way to the shuttle together, after Alexa was found. The choice itself wasn't bad. You couldn't have known the storm would destroy the shuttle... But it did lead to Alexa's death and her safety was your responsibility. I will have to talk to high command about your failure here.
^made sure both of our researchers ended up safely in their base. Now we must try to find a way to get them out of there, while that storm rages.. And before their rations run out...
^let one of your team abandon the other. At least Christina made it off the surface alive, but Alexa's life was your responsibility and will have to go into the report.
^were entirely indecisive and your indecisiveness led to the deaths of both of your team members. This was a huge failure. And a painful loss.
^left poor Alexa out there to die, while Christina can now safely wait in the base.. You did manage to protect one of your researchers but we should not leave our people behind.
